body.p:
Owen County Ky April 29th 1864
To his Excellency
Thomas. E. Bramlett
Govenor of the Commonwealth of Ky

The undersigned your petitioners would Respectfully Represent to your Excellency that at term of the Owen Circuit Court John Howard a free man of Colour was indicted and fined in the sum of Sixty dollars for keeping a tipling house in said County.

Your petitioners, and neighbors to Said Howard would further Represent that at the time of the alledged tipling the Justices Court has held at the house of said Howard and by the earnest Solicitation of various Reputable persons he (said Howard) was induced to procure liquer for the accomadation of those in attendance on said Court, and whilst we do not claim this as a Justification We Regard it as grounds for an earnest appeal to executive clemency, - We therefore petition your excellency to Remit the fine to the Extent of your Execution Controll of the same.

H B Glass
